comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

During normal browsing, the source URL from an iframe tag on a page will load in a new tab automatically when the page is loaded (it also loads normally in the page itself). This does not happen 100% of the time, but it happens quite often. Typically, the new tab contains ad content. It has happened, on occasion, where as many as 5 new tabs were opened when a page with 5 different Amazon affiliate links were embedded was loaded.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Load URL in browser.
Actual Results:  
A new tab opened on its own, containing an advertisement from the page.

Expected Results:  
No tab should be opening.
comments.author: develdevil@gmail.com
comments.creator: develdevil@gmail.com

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

Works fine for me. Please try if it works fine in safe mode or try by creating a new profile. 
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing+profiles#Creating_a_profile.

comments.raw_text: I sometimes get iframes opening in a new tab too. I opened a yahoo news story and the iframes and tweetmeme opened in a new tab
comments.creator: alex.j.smith@btinternet.com
